description: This course will introduce knowledge of the fundamentals with Windows operating system concepts in a Windows environment. The viewer will learn about basic management of Windows operating systems such as basic configuration, updating systems as well as a variety of tools available to ensure an operational and stable Windows environment.
descriptionMD: This course will introduce knowledge of the fundamentals with Windows operating system concepts in a Windows environment. The viewer will learn about basic management of Windows operating systems such as basic configuration, updating systems as well as a variety of tools available to ensure an operational and stable Windows environment.
name: MTA - Windows Operating System Fundamentals -  98-349 (UPDATE 2018)
subtitle: Windows Operating System Fundamentals

episodes.description: This course will introduce knowledge of the fundamentals with Windows operating system concepts in a Windows environment. The viewer will learn about basic management of Windows operating systems such as basic configuration, updating systems as well as a variety of tools available to ensure an operational and stable Windows environment.
episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.025 --> 00:00:05.660
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:05.660 --> 00:00:10.655
Hello, we'd like to take some time to tell
you what you can expect in the upcoming

3
00:00:10.655 --> 00:00:13.480
MTA Windows OS Fundamentals series.

4
00:00:13.480 --> 00:00:17.090
We've gone ahead and
we've browsed to our Microsoft website,

5
00:00:17.090 --> 00:00:21.550
the Microsoft website that shows you the
objectives and the domain breakdown for

6
00:00:21.550 --> 00:00:25.160
this exam and
really who this exam is targeted to.

7
00:00:25.160 --> 00:00:30.524
You can see, if you will look, by going
to, actually, it's www.microsoft.com,

8
00:00:30.524 --> 00:00:35.020
and you can see it's under
the Learning page, and it's 98-349.

9
00:00:35.020 --> 00:00:37.270
And when you get to this page,

10
00:00:37.270 --> 00:00:42.450
it basically will give you
the breakdown for the entire exam.

11
00:00:42.450 --> 00:00:45.320
You can see what the target
audience is for this exam.

12
00:00:45.320 --> 00:00:50.120
You can see, for instance, Home PC users,
academic, IT workers, IT professionals,

13
00:00:50.120 --> 00:00:50.850
and developers.

14
00:00:50.850 --> 00:00:56.400
I will tell you that if you are new
to IT in general, the MTA exams,

15
00:00:56.400 --> 00:01:00.960
the Microsoft Technology Associates,
if you weren't aware what that acronym is.

16
00:01:00.960 --> 00:01:06.295
These exams are very, very critical,
I think, in helping people to

17
00:01:06.295 --> 00:01:11.425
understand some the fundamental concepts
that we see in just about every network,

18
00:01:11.425 --> 00:01:14.355
but including more specific
to a Windows environment.

19
00:01:14.355 --> 00:01:18.975
So, great way to leapfrog your
career if you're just starting out.

20
00:01:18.975 --> 00:01:22.595
Let's go ahead and take the time to show
you what you can actually see domain-wise

21
00:01:22.595 --> 00:01:25.200
when it comes to
the breakdown of this exam.

22
00:01:25.200 --> 00:01:27.730
Now, I will say at the time
of the filming of this exam,

23
00:01:27.730 --> 00:01:30.870
if you do go to this website,
you will see that it says,

24
00:01:30.870 --> 00:01:35.020
August 31, 2016,
this exam includes updates for Windows 10.

25
00:01:35.020 --> 00:01:38.970
Know that at the time that
we're recording this overview,

26
00:01:38.970 --> 00:01:44.030
Windows 10 content has
been put into the 98-349

27
00:01:44.030 --> 00:01:48.020
MTA Windows OS Fundamentals
series that you're about to view.

28
00:01:49.180 --> 00:01:50.590
If you scroll down a little bit farther,

29
00:01:50.590 --> 00:01:54.790
you will see that we have six domains and
15% to 20% in each domain,

30
00:01:54.790 --> 00:01:59.340
which means it's gonna vary a little bit
to give you a totality of 100% coverage

31
00:01:59.340 --> 00:02:03.580
in all the objectives, the skills
measured, as Microsoft calls it.

32
00:02:03.580 --> 00:02:05.740
You'll see the very first one,

33
00:02:05.740 --> 00:02:08.660
we're gonna see Understanding
operating system configurations, and

34
00:02:08.660 --> 00:02:12.640
if we expand that out, you can see some of
the concepts that we're gonna go through.

35
00:02:12.640 --> 00:02:14.130
For instance, the control panel.

36
00:02:14.130 --> 00:02:16.750
The control panel being
the graphical user interface that

37
00:02:16.750 --> 00:02:20.660
really helps us to administer to
the entire Windows operating system and

38
00:02:20.660 --> 00:02:23.040
in the environment surrounding it.

39
00:02:23.040 --> 00:02:26.280
You can see things like desktop settings
and some of the various things that we

40
00:02:26.280 --> 00:02:31.210
can do to customize Windows to make
it unique to the user experience.

41
00:02:31.210 --> 00:02:32.920
As well as some of
the native applications and

42
00:02:32.920 --> 00:02:35.520
tools that are inside of
our operating system,

43
00:02:35.520 --> 00:02:38.810
including some of the web browsers,
like, for instance, Microsoft's Edge.

44
00:02:38.810 --> 00:02:42.470
The artificial intelligent
personal assistant, Cortana,

45
00:02:42.470 --> 00:02:46.311
we're gonna talk about, including things
like virtualization through Hyper-V,

46
00:02:46.311 --> 00:02:51.040
MSCONFIG system configuration utility,
and much more.

47
00:02:51.040 --> 00:02:55.310
Now, if you have mobile devices, remember
that mobile devices are important for

48
00:02:55.310 --> 00:02:58.210
not only the mobility, but one of the
things that we have to look at is power

49
00:02:58.210 --> 00:03:01.650
conservation and making sure that
we have proper thermal management.

50
00:03:01.650 --> 00:03:05.080
Well, one of the things that you have
inside of the operating system is

51
00:03:05.080 --> 00:03:08.490
a centralized location called
the Windows Mobility Center and

52
00:03:08.490 --> 00:03:12.500
a couple of other technologies that
we'll be taking a look at there as well.

53
00:03:12.500 --> 00:03:15.480
We'll also be looking at MMCs,
Microsoft Management Console,

54
00:03:15.480 --> 00:03:20.340
some of the various management tools,
not just limited to Windows PowerShell or

55
00:03:20.340 --> 00:03:24.220
the Windows PowerShell Integrated
Script Environment, or ISE.

56
00:03:24.220 --> 00:03:29.160
We'll be looking at various Windows
administrative utilities likewise, too.

57
00:03:29.160 --> 00:03:33.420
And you can see some of the preparation
resources that you can use in addition to

58
00:03:33.420 --> 00:03:36.350
your ITPro.TV series here.

59
00:03:36.350 --> 00:03:40.450
Now, moving into the next one, the next
domain, you can see that installing and

60
00:03:40.450 --> 00:03:42.350
upgrading client systems,
this is important.

61
00:03:42.350 --> 00:03:45.550
Well, how do you get the operating
system on your machine?

62
00:03:45.550 --> 00:03:48.680
So we'll be going through identifying
some of the different editions

63
00:03:48.680 --> 00:03:52.680
of Windows as well as upgrading
from maybe an earlier

64
00:03:52.680 --> 00:03:56.300
edition of Windows to a newer edition of
Windows and some of the things that you

65
00:03:56.300 --> 00:04:01.070
need to keep in mind when you
perform that type of function.

66
00:04:01.070 --> 00:04:04.930
Including understanding installation
types, whether it be a clean installation,

67
00:04:04.930 --> 00:04:09.130
whether it be an upgrade installation,
we'll be talking about that likewise, too.

68
00:04:09.130 --> 00:04:11.850
As well as operating system architecture,
right?

69
00:04:11.850 --> 00:04:14.244
What is the difference between 32-bit and
64-bit?

70
00:04:14.244 --> 00:04:17.638
Well, you're gonna have to stay
tuned to the series to find out.

71
00:04:17.638 --> 00:04:21.460
And you can see some of the preparation
materials that they also have that I would

72
00:04:21.460 --> 00:04:26.210
highly recommend that will help complement
and supplement your training as well.

73
00:04:26.210 --> 00:04:30.120
Then we have managing applications,
15% to 20% of the entire exam.

74
00:04:30.120 --> 00:04:32.040
Likewise, you'll see
configuring applications.

75
00:04:32.040 --> 00:04:35.500
We'll talk about when those applications
are just stored on a local hard drive

76
00:04:35.500 --> 00:04:39.880
versus one that you reach out across the
network and maybe connect to, including

77
00:04:39.880 --> 00:04:45.034
some of the security settings that we
can do inside of our operating system.

78
00:04:45.034 --> 00:04:49.500
User account control, for instance,
the user account control allowing us to

79
00:04:49.500 --> 00:04:53.860
give somebody only the level of access
they need to perform their job, no more or

80
00:04:53.860 --> 00:04:54.460
no less.

81
00:04:54.460 --> 00:04:58.150
As well as antivirus settings, for
instance, Windows Defender we'll be

82
00:04:58.150 --> 00:05:02.872
talking about, and the MRT, also known as
the Malicious Software Removal Toolkit.

83
00:05:02.872 --> 00:05:07.240
Last sub-objective you
will in this domain,

84
00:05:07.240 --> 00:05:10.690
you'll see understanding service types,
those background processes that happen day

85
00:05:10.690 --> 00:05:14.650
to day and a lot of times we don't
interact with until you're into

86
00:05:14.650 --> 00:05:18.980
some kind of support environment where
maybe you do need to configure those.

87
00:05:20.460 --> 00:05:23.740
Moving down the list, we have also
managing files and folders, and

88
00:05:23.740 --> 00:05:27.613
this is important because we need to
store our information somewhere, so

89
00:05:27.613 --> 00:05:30.150
we need to know how we store
the information, right?

90
00:05:30.150 --> 00:05:32.200
What file systems are available?

91
00:05:32.200 --> 00:05:35.550
How do we get the hard drives, or even
solid-state drives, for that matter, how

92
00:05:35.550 --> 00:05:40.180
do we get them configured and prepped so
that we can not only install our operating

93
00:05:40.180 --> 00:05:44.180
system but also utilize it as a storage
location for our files and folders?

94
00:05:44.180 --> 00:05:49.124
So you can see, we'll talk about some
different file systems including FAT32,

95
00:05:49.124 --> 00:05:53.375
NTFS, and the resilient file system,
we'll talk about ReFS as well.

96
00:05:53.375 --> 00:05:56.847
We'll talk about how you can
control access through ACLs, or

97
00:05:56.847 --> 00:05:58.190
access control lists.

98
00:05:58.190 --> 00:06:02.350
You can control the level of access that
somebody has, either allow them access or

99
00:06:02.350 --> 00:06:04.970
deny them access through permission sets.

100
00:06:04.970 --> 00:06:06.610
So we'll talk about
configuring permissions,

101
00:06:06.610 --> 00:06:10.360
including configuring things like
shares in the shared permissions when

102
00:06:10.360 --> 00:06:14.030
people need to connect to those
resources over the networks.

103
00:06:14.030 --> 00:06:16.560
We'll also talk about encryption,
encryption is important.

104
00:06:16.560 --> 00:06:20.340
Remember, we're keeping the information
on the machine confidential so

105
00:06:20.340 --> 00:06:22.380
only the authorized
users have access to it.

106
00:06:22.380 --> 00:06:26.570
So we'll be looking at concepts like that,
including opening up File Explorer and

107
00:06:26.570 --> 00:06:30.510
looking at various libraries and how we
can control and configure those libraries

108
00:06:30.510 --> 00:06:33.860
inside of the file and folder
management graphical user interface.

109
00:06:35.560 --> 00:06:38.083
Next in the list,
you're gonna see managing devices,

110
00:06:38.083 --> 00:06:39.390
this is important, right?

111
00:06:39.390 --> 00:06:43.220
This is one of the things that you're
gonna do in a support type of role.

112
00:06:43.220 --> 00:06:45.940
So, not only is this important for
your exam, but

113
00:06:45.940 --> 00:06:47.850
it's also important in the real world.

114
00:06:47.850 --> 00:06:52.770
Including connecting devices and
disconnecting devices to your machine,

115
00:06:52.770 --> 00:06:56.880
your Windows operating system, whether it
be wireless through a Bluetooth device, or

116
00:06:56.880 --> 00:06:58.670
whether it be a wired connection.

117
00:06:58.670 --> 00:07:01.290
And including understanding
things like storage, right?

118
00:07:01.290 --> 00:07:03.780
When we talk about managing our devices,

119
00:07:03.780 --> 00:07:08.055
we have to understand how to manage
the storage devices that we utilize

120
00:07:08.055 --> 00:07:11.825
in order to store the information for
reuse at a later time.

121
00:07:11.825 --> 00:07:13.565
We also have to look at printing devices.

122
00:07:13.565 --> 00:07:17.545
Printing is important, whether it's
in the home environment or if it is

123
00:07:17.545 --> 00:07:20.985
in a corporate environment, and we're
gonna talk about some of the concepts and

124
00:07:20.985 --> 00:07:25.090
attributes around printers and
printing devices.

125
00:07:25.090 --> 00:07:28.540
Last, but not least, in this domain, we'll
also talk about system devices, including

126
00:07:28.540 --> 00:07:33.060
how to configure and understand audio and
video devices, including IR devices.

127
00:07:33.060 --> 00:07:36.420
And last but
not least here in understanding devices,

128
00:07:36.420 --> 00:07:40.080
where do we go to manage all
of the hardware devices and

129
00:07:40.080 --> 00:07:43.420
drivers associated with them through
something known as Device Manager.

130
00:07:45.390 --> 00:07:48.480
Now, that is the second-to-last domain.

131
00:07:48.480 --> 00:07:51.360
The last domain that we have
here is understanding operating

132
00:07:51.360 --> 00:07:52.437
system maintenance.

133
00:07:52.437 --> 00:07:56.830
Again, 15% to 20% of the overall exam, and
this is a very, very important domain.

134
00:07:56.830 --> 00:08:01.125
They're all equally important, but when
it comes to a recovery situation, this is

135
00:08:01.125 --> 00:08:04.945
definitely something you wanna know
when it comes to the exam and help desk.

136
00:08:04.945 --> 00:08:06.165
So we'll look at backup and

137
00:08:06.165 --> 00:08:10.525
recovery methods as well as some of the
maintenance utilities that we have inside

138
00:08:10.525 --> 00:08:15.955
of our operating system to make sure that
the Windows operating system is optimized.

139
00:08:15.955 --> 00:08:20.245
And then last but not least,
we'll definitely talk about configuring

140
00:08:20.245 --> 00:08:23.210
updates and
some of the patch management thoughts and

141
00:08:23.210 --> 00:08:26.780
concepts that you need to know surrounding
the Windows 10 operating system so

142
00:08:26.780 --> 00:08:32.100
that you can apply updates, and
maintain a reasonable level of stability,

143
00:08:32.100 --> 00:08:37.540
and maintain a good,
healthy operating system.

144
00:08:37.540 --> 00:08:40.790
These are some of the technologies and
some of the domains, the six domains,

145
00:08:40.790 --> 00:08:45.870
that you can see inside of our
MTA Windows OS Fundamentals exams.

146
00:08:45.870 --> 00:08:47.432
Stay tuned cuz we got more to come.

147
00:08:47.432 --> 00:08:54.071
[MUSIC]

episodes.description: n this episode Zach and Wes explore different tools, settings and configuration utilities in the Windows Control Panel. They look at administrative tools, accessibility options and more.
episodes.title: Configuring Control Panel

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes continue their exploration of different tools, settings and configuration utilities in the Windows Control Panel. They demonstrate accessibility options such as Narrator, Magnifier, closed captions and more.
episodes.title: Configuring Control Panel Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes continue their exploration of different tools, settings and configuration utilities in the Windows Control Panel. They look at the power settings and the file and folder management utility called File Explorer
episodes.title: Configuring Control Panel Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes continue their exploration of different tools, settings and configuration utilities in the Windows Control Panel.
episodes.title: Configuring Control Panel Part 4

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes explore different attributes, utilities and tools to configure the primary Windows interface known as the Desktop.
episodes.title: Configuring Desktop Settings

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes explore different attributes, utilities and tools to configure the primary Windows interface known as the Desktop
episodes.title: Configuring Desktop Settings Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode Dan and Wes explore different applications built into the Windows operating system. They discuss Microsoft's Edge browser, Cortana, Hyper-V and more.
episodes.title: Configuring Native Applications and Tools

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes explore different mobile setttings found in the Windows operating system. They discuss Sync Center, the Windows Mobility Center and Remote Desktop
episodes.title: Configuring Mobile Settings

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes explore the various Windows OS editions, hardware and compatibility requirements. They will also discuss the valid upgrade paths from previous versions of Windows.
episodes.title: Identify Windows OS Editions

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes explore the various Windows OS editions, hardware and compatibility requirements. They will also discuss the valid upgrade paths from previous versions of Windows.
episodes.title: Identify Installations and Architecture Types

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes explore application configuration, startup options, Windows SmartScreen, the Windows Store and more.
episodes.title: Configuring Applications

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes explore Window's standard user security architecture, the user account control and various settings for the UAC, Windows Defender, the Malicious Software Removal Tool as well as services.
episodes.title: Configuring UAC and Antivirus

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes continue their exploration on Window's standard user security architecture, the user account control and various settings for the UAC, Windows Defender, the Malicious Software Removal Tool as well as services.
episodes.title: Configuring UAC and Antivirus Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes continue their exploration on Window's standard user security architecture, the user account control and various settings for the UAC, Windows Defender, the Malicious Software Removal Tool as well as services.
episodes.title: Configuring UAC and Antivirus Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes explore Window's the different file systems inside of the Windows operating system.
episodes.title: Understanding File Systems

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes explore ways to group and catalog files from different locations via File Explorer-based libraries. They also dive into how to make files available when the network is not.
episodes.title: Understanding Libraries

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes explore various storage technologies. They look at drive types such as basic, primary, logical and more. Finally they will talk about the Microsoft cloud-based storage solution called OneDrive.
episodes.title: Understanding Storage

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes explore print devices, local vs. networked printers, print queues and Internet printing.
episodes.title: Understanding Storage Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes explore print devices, local vs. networked printers, print queues and Internet printing.
episodes.title: Understanding Storage Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes explore print devices, local vs. networked printers, print queues and Internet printing.
episodes.title: Understanding Storage Part 4

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes explore print devices, local vs. networked printers, print queues and Internet printing.
episodes.title: Understanding Print Devices

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes explore ways to attach devices to a Windows client. They look at plug-and-play and Bluetooth devices, connecting and disconnecting printers.
episodes.title: Understanding and Connecting Devices

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes explore various way to copy critical data through backup methods. They also look at ways to recover data through technologies.
episodes.title: Understanding Backup and Recovery

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes explore various way to copy critical data through backup methods. They also look at ways to recover data through technologies.
episodes.title: Understanding Backup and Recovery Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes explore various way to copy critical data through backup methods. They also look at ways to recover data through technologies.
episodes.title: Understanding Backup and Recovery Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes explore various way to maintain and manage the Windows operating system environment. They discuss topics like Disk Defragmenter, Task Scheduler and System Information as well as administrative tools like Windows PowerShell and ISE.
episodes.title: Maintenance and Management Tools

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes explore various way to copy critical data through backup methods. They also look at ways to recover data through technologies.
episodes.title: Configuring Updates

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes continue their discussion on Windows updates. They demonstrate how to apply updates to a Windows operating system and discuss how to roll back updates should they become problematic.
episodes.title: Configuring Updates Part 2
